page.title: 19TRADE & SHOPS:FENNY COMPTON.
page.content: There are three shops within the grid area- 1,the {CO-OPERATIVE SOCIETY } this serves about 50 customers a day,most of them pensioners. most are on foot, & purchase groceries sweets, vegetables,cigarettes or household goods.Most of these customers visit the Banbury Shopping Centre at least once a week,tho' some pensioners chose to avoid the expense of petrol & car parking in town.The{BUTCHER'S SHOP} serves about 150 people a week with lamb,pork & beef,offal,meat pies and cold meat.Deliveries ae from Banbury & Stratford Cattle Markets. The {POST {OFFICE }had about 40 visitors on the Thursday morning surveyed,many being pensioners collecting their weekly pensions,buying stamps,posting letters & buying newspapers.Letters come by van from Leamington, then they are delivered locally by a postlady.
